dataList.content: Before us stood a monumental castle of ice, and frozen pillars that seemed unbreakable.
And there stood a person…
A man with hyaline hair, clear as ice, waiting for us.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: I came here often whenever I felt the need to clear my thoughts, even though there’s no rocking chairs or whisky you like…

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: The chill dominating this place pierces even the thickest coat. It helps me restore a lucid mind.
While the rest of us were frozen stiff, stuck watching, Rodya made a slow step forward to face him.
Didn’t expect you to be here first.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: My men and I knew of a shortcut leading here.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: It was something we learned through the local ruffians, all in search of the whereabouts of a buried, great power, waiting to be used for the greater good.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Alas, this… area surrounding the Golden Bough was as far as we could go; we didn’t see any way to get closer.
Thought you’d never leave District 25, but seeing you now—resorting to the tactics gangsters would use—maybe you should’ve stayed a country boy.
Sonya, your lackeys have been taking from shopkeeps who weren’t even rich to begin with.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: …Did you know, Rodya? This was little more than a somewhat eccentric hollow with frosty walls.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Yet look at this. Now there’s a giant castle and thick columns of ice.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: This change happened the instant you walked in.
…You sound like you figured this would happen on my arrival. How’d you know?

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: I have many sources… But that’s none of your business, Rodya.
What makes you so sure that I made this happen in the first place? I’m not some kinda Backstreets witch or anything.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: It’s not hard at all to figure out. Observing those faces encased in ice says enough.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Take a peek. They’re ones you loved yet looked down on, are they not?

dataList.title: District 25
dataList.content: Two-fifty thousand Ahn.

dataList.title: District 25
dataList.content: That’s all it’s worth? It’s not possible…

dataList.title: District 25
dataList.content: You said precisely why, though? Its age is showing in all the scratches and lack of polish.

dataList.title: District 25
dataList.content: To be frank, others wouldn’t pay any more than two hundred thousand for this.

dataList.title: District 25
dataList.content: And the rest… All worthless garbage.

dataList.title: District 25
dataList.content: That makes the taxes you owe four hundred thousand Ahn in total.
Why do the poor only grow poorer the harder they work?
It’s ridiculous, isn’t it? While stacks of cash piled up in the pawnbroker’s vault…
Our neighborhood was being wrung dry, heirlooms weighed for what little monetary value they had.
Sonya rallied people, delivering speeches using big words.
They organized a group under the name of the ‘Yurodiviye’.
It went okay at first. Even the thickest folks were inspired by Sonya’s words to help the impoverished in the Backstreets.
But, Sonya still had a dissatisfied expression.
Ultimately, the Yurodiviye warped into an organization that cared more for debating about how best to change the streets and the Nest, rather than going out to help those in need.
That’s why I left them.
Being an armchair revolutionary wasn’t going to feed our starving neighbors!

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: But I told you time and time again, Rodya. That we must wait for the right moment.
Sonya, I’m sorry, but that “moment” you kept talking about…
It didn’t come when the Yurodiviye’s youngest… when little Ivan had to sate his hunger with food from the garbage.
Nor did it arrive after he suffocated to death.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: To achieve a monumental task, well-thought policies and a great power to carry them are required. All to make the redistribution of wealth happen.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: And in the process of moving towards progress, such minor troubles on a personal level are inevitable.
That’s minor to you? The whole thing was personal, we started this to help others.
What you and the Yurodiviye were doing wasn’t what I’d hoped for.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Is that why you decided to take matters into your own hands?
Absolutely. What our town needed…
Wasn’t an empty promise telling people to sit on their hands for who knows when.
But someone who wouldn’t hesitate to pick up the axe.
I bet most of my neighbors had been starving for four nights straight that day.
Yet the biting wind kept hounding without mercy, clawing at the chapped skin of the famished peasants.
And I happened to know whose safe kept more than enough money to treat my neighbors to a feast for days and still be just as full.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: So, what did you do?
…Gimme a sec. Can’t I pull out of this now?

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: This is a confessional created for you as a result of the Golden Bough resonating with your psyche.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Moreover, a confessional’s purpose is to lead a sinner to the path of penance.
If only that old woman had changed her mind before it came to an end…

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: But Rodya…

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: You must have known that a terminal leech upon her neighbors would never turn over a new leaf.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: You know she wasn’t the kind of person who’d give up that life to turn into a generous philanthropist.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: You wouldn’t have knocked on her door with an axe in hand otherwise.

dataList.title: District 25
dataList.content: Poor Rodion, dear, you seem to be under the delusion that you’re some sort of savior…

dataList.title: District 25
dataList.content: Demanding my money so brazenly to my face won’t change anything.

dataList.title: District 25
dataList.content: You vermin are no different from the paupers in the Backstreets.
That’s right.
I’m the one who put an axe through her head.
Like cutting open the belly of the goose that laid golden eggs, I chopped that hag’s skull.
I mean, someone had to do it. Am I wrong?
Unlike the foolish cottager in the fable who gave in to greed and lost out on becoming richer…
We were overcome with hunger and misery, and could have gladly eaten out her brains.
And her “belly” was full of golden eggs, unlike that of the goose.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Yes, the old lady you killed was a tax collector wielding considerable authority in District 25.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: But what gave her so much power… was her sibling’s status as a member of the Middle.
I… struck her down to save my dying neighbors. Is that so wrong?

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: No, you held that axe for your own good.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: You couldn’t stand the fact that you weren’t anyone special.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Did you know? The Middle… never lets anyone who touches their family go unpunished.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: They aren’t too interested in finding *who* exactly did it; rather, they like to demonstrate clearly *what* happens to the poor fools that dare disturb them.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: The Backstreets residents who’d tasted the joy of quality meat for the first time in their lives soon made towering cadaverous pillars out on the roads.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Not much different from the car pagodas outside the casino.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: I’m well aware of how much pain and guilt you’ve been burdened with ever since then.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Living with the realization that you really weren’t so different from the foolish cottager after all.
Since that day… Nothing I held truly felt like it was mine.
All because of me…

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: It’s all fine, Rodya.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: For you see, Rodya.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: To change the world, I perused hundreds of books and thousands of documents…

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: And I met various people all around the City.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Picturing a world where the oppressed can escape from the exploitative dominion of the ruling class and find liberation in the truest sense.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: To make that world a reality.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: However, the answer didn’t lie in changing what was already there. Once a page of history is written, there’s no way to go back and revise it.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Look. This is the world we can reach.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: A world… that can be created using the Golden Bough with which you resonated.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: May there be no one upon this earth suffering from starvation.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: May every individual enjoy the right to pursue psychological and intellectual delights.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: …Join hands with me, and I’ll give you that world as a gift.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: As if nothing up to this point had ever happened at all.
Ah.
A feeling nobody else would understand.
Even a glimpse of that world felt so dreamlike.
I wanted to etch that mesmerizing instant into my memory.
If this was a dream, I’d even wish I was part of it so that I would never have to leave it.
And yet…
Sorry, I’m still turning down your offer.
How to put it…
I don’t wanna bathe in warmth just yet. I feel like I oughta be in this cold a bit longer.
Think I’ll stay this way until I find my answer to the question of when it’ll be okay to warm myself.
And also, Sonya…
You knew my temper would get the best of me and get me to kill her, didn’t you?

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Rodya, this will probably elude you, but you don’t have the mark.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: I came here hoping to see you possess it, but I’m seeing it on a few of your friends instead.
The mark? What do you…

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: Besides, you can’t see the mark, either. In other words… you don’t have what it takes to be a leader.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: But I’m different. So, to make a better world—
Yepper, I think I ‘member hearing you say something like that while sat at a desk buried in books.
…That’s why I can’t join you.
I still believe that it’s not big words behind closed doors that feed your neighbors.
And as I’m sure you’ve learned by now…
There’s no way a rowdy rascal like me would fit under some dweeb’s leadership, right? Hahah!

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: The Golden Bough awaits inside the castle, Rodya.

dataList.title: Yurodivy
dataList.content: I hope you’ll be able to find what you seek.
We walked past Sonya, and then made our way into the icy castle he indicated.
